medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent psoriasiform eruption accentuated in intertriginous areas.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 3 years ago, initially involving the inguinal and axillary regions but progressed to cover 70% of total body surface area. Treatment with numerous topical agents and medications was ineffective.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past treatment includes prednisone, methotrexate, and acitretin. No previous surgeries or chronic illnesses specified.
medical_history.family_history: Family medical history includes diabetes, hypertension, cancer, and thyroid disease.
